seal.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a large sea animal that eats fish and lives around coasts
seal.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
seal.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The document carried the seal of the governorâ€™s office.
seal.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the object that is used to make this mark
seal.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a piece of rubber or plastic that keeps air, water, dirt etc out of something
seal.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: an airtight seal around the windows
seal.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a piece of wax, paper, wire etc that you have to break in order to open a container, document etc
seal.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it
seal.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Dried milk is kept in hermetically sealed  (=very tightly closed) containers.
A quick way to seal awkward gaps is to use a foam filler.
seal.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if a building, area, or country is sealed, no one can enter or leave it
seal.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Authorities plan to seal the border.
seal.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to close an envelope, package etc by using something sticky to hold its edges in place
seal.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: He wrote the address and sealed the envelope.
seal.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to cover the surface of something with something that will protect it
seal.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Wooden decks should be sealed to prevent cracking.
seal.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
seal.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to do something that makes a deal, agreement etc formal and definite
